skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: Official skill from Anthropic with pre-reviewed guidance and helper scripts. No security concerns found in the codebase.

content.user_title: Create reliable AI skills with structured templates
content.value_statement: Creating skills without structure leads to inconsistent quality and wasted time. This skill provides proven templates, validation tools, and packaging guidance to build professional skills faster.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new skill folders with proper SKILL.md templates
Validate SKILL.md frontmatter format and naming conventions
Provide workflow design patterns and output formatting guides
Enforce best practices for concise skill documentation
limitations: Does not write domain-specific content or workflows
Validation only checks format, not content quality
Requires Python 3 and PyYAML for scripts
Cannot publish or install skills to marketplaces

use_cases.title: Start new skills quickly
use_cases.description: Generate structured skill templates with proper metadata and resource organization.

use_cases.title: Validate skill submissions
use_cases.description: Check SKILL.md formatting and naming before accepting community skills.

use_cases.title: Package for distribution
use_cases.description: Bundle validated skills into shareable .skill files for deployment.

prompt_templates.title: Create skill skeleton
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill named data-validator under skills folder with all default templates and placeholders.

prompt_templates.title: Validate existing skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the skill at skills/data-validator and report any frontmatter or naming issues.

prompt_templates.title: Package for sharing
prompt_templates.prompt: Package the validated skill at skills/data-validator into a .skill file in the dist folder.

prompt_templates.title: Apply workflow pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the SKILL.md to follow the sequential workflow pattern from references/workflows.md.

output_examples.input: Create a new skill named invoice-processor under skills/private.
output: Generated SKILL.md with proper YAML frontmatter
Added example scripts, references, and asset directories
Ready for customization - edit SKILL.md and add your resources

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines and move details to references
Use hyphen-case names and clear trigger descriptions
Always validate before packaging or sharing skills
anti_patterns: Creating README.md or extra documentation files
Writing vague descriptions that do not state when to use

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The templates and scripts work across all Claude platforms.

faq.question: What does validation check?
faq.answer: It verifies YAML frontmatter, naming format, and description length only.

faq.question: Can I use it in my CI pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Run the validation and packaging scripts from any automation workflow.

faq.question: Does it upload my skill data?
faq.answer: No. All operations run locally on your machine.

faq.question: How do I fix validation errors?
faq.answer: Update the SKILL.md frontmatter to match the required format and run validation again.

faq.question: Why use this instead of manual creation?
faq.answer: It provides tested templates and automated checks that prevent common mistakes.
